general_initial_conditions.description: Top-level general initial conditions. Values can use BDD patterns (e.g., 'create directory "/tmp/test"') that are automatically converted to executable commands, or plain text that becomes comments. See docs/BDD_INITIAL_CONDITIONS.md for pattern reference.

items.description: A condition statement. Can be a BDD pattern (e.g., 'create directory "/path"', 'set environment variable "VAR" to "value"', 'wait for 5 seconds') or plain text description.

initial_conditions.description: Top-level initial conditions specific to devices/systems. Values can use BDD patterns (e.g., 'file "/path" should exist', 'restart service "nginx"') that are automatically converted to executable commands, or plain text that becomes comments. See docs/BDD_INITIAL_CONDITIONS.md for pattern reference.

items.description: A condition statement. Can be a BDD pattern (e.g., 'ping device "192.168.1.1" with 3 retries', 'port 80 on "localhost" should be open') or plain text description.

variables.description: Sequence-scoped variables that can be declared and used throughout the test sequence.

initial_conditions.description: Sequence-level initial conditions. Values can use BDD patterns (e.g., 'wait until file "/tmp/ready" exists with timeout 30 seconds') that are automatically converted to executable commands, or plain text that becomes comments. See docs/BDD_INITIAL_CONDITIONS.md for pattern reference.

items.description: A condition statement. Can be a BDD pattern or plain text description.

capture_vars.description: Variable names as keys with regex patterns as values for extracting values from COMMAND_OUTPUT.
